WAY Schools allow students to explore authentic, engaging, and real-world problems through Project-Based Learning. But what exactly is it?

While so many schools are trying to break free from the traditional school culture set in place centuries ago, there is still a struggle to find the right fit. The misconception is that PBL is just like "doing a project" but it's much more than that! In project based learning, the learning comes alive for students and they are engaged in a project over a period of time solving real world problems and responding to authentic, complex and engaging questions.

This is what we do at WAY and this is why our students are so successful! Join us and find your success this new school year! Enroll now for the 2020-21 school year at WAY Academy! More information at http://wayacademy.net

What exactly is Project Based Learning? While so many schools are trying to break free from the traditional school culture set in place centuries ago, there is still a struggle to find the right fit. The misconception is that PBL is just like "doing a project" but it's much more than that! In project based learning, the learning comes alive for students and they are engaged in a project over a period of time solving real world problems and responding to authentic, complex and engaging questions.

This is what we do at WAY and this is why our students are so successful!

WAY Academy of Flint - Blended Learning Model

Blended learning is providing students a new education opportunity. Today's educational technology allows students the ability to learn anywhere, which is what makes the blended learning model possible. Is blended learning for everyone? No. There are many ways to learn and there is no one-size fits all model.

What does it take to be successful in a blended learning model?

You need...Self-Motivation, Self-Discipline, to be a goal setter, the ability to be proactive with your learning, willing to collaborate with others, curiosity and desire, a good support sytem to keep you going to reach your goals, your top priority to be your education, and the ability to be an independent learner.

If you have many of these qualities, then blended learning just may be the opportunity that helps you accelerate your education and takes you to the next level.

Traditional learning vs Blended Learning

In a traditonal school model, students are mostly assigned their grade level according to their age. Typically, at the end of each school year, a student will be promoted to the next grade level, even if they didn't perform well. This is how you can have a student that is in the 12th grade, but still hasn't passed English 10 and 11.

Our blended learning model is based off the college model. A student's grade level is determined by the credit they have earned. We base everything on the merit system. If you work hard, you will be rewarded. This is how in our system a 16 year old may be a Senior. The student has pushed his/herself to master the content and move ahead.

At WAY, our blended model removes the barriers of the traditional model and pushes a student to "Just go for it."
